00050   //  bricking control
00051   enum BRICK_STATE  {
00052     BRICK_ON_1  = 0x00000001,
00053     BRICK_ON_2  = 0x00000002,
00054     BRICK_READY = 0x00000004
00055   };
00056 
00057   DefineClass(Brick);
00058   typedef  PPBrick * PPPBrick;
00059 
00060   class Brick  {
00061 
00062     public :
00063       int     nAtoms;  // number of atoms hit into brick
00064       PPAtom  atom;  // pointers to atoms
00065       ivector id;  // atom ids (in present realization, these are
00066                        // indices of atoms from the bricked array)
00067 
00068       Brick ();
00069       ~Brick();
00070 
00071       void  Clear   ();
00072       void  AddAtom ( PAtom A, int atomid );
00073 
00074     protected :
00075       int  nAllocAtoms;
00076       void InitBrick();
00077 
00078   };

00430 
00431       //   GetAtom(CID) returns atom answering to the following
00432       // CID pattern:
00433       //   /mdl/chn/seq(res).i/atm[elm]:a
00434       // where
00435       //   mdl   - model number (mandatory); at least model #1 is always
00436       //           present
00437       //   chn   - chain identifier ( mandatory)
00438       //   seq   - residue sequence number (mandatory)
00439       //   (res) - residue name in round brackets (may be omitted)
00440       //   .i    - insert code after a dot; if '.i' or 'i' is missing
00441       //           then residue without an insertion code is looked
00442       //           for
00443       //   atm   - atom name (mandatory)
00444       //   [elm] - chemical element code in square brackets; it may
00445       //           be omitted but could be helpful for e.g.
00446       //           distinguishing C_alpha and CA
00447       //   :a    - alternate location indicator after colon; if
00448       //           ':a' or 'a' is missing then an atom without
00449       //           alternate location indicator is looked for.
00450       // All spaces are ignored, all identifiers should be in capital
00451       // letters (comparisons are case-sensitive).
00452       PAtom GetAtom ( cpstr CID );
00453 
00454 
00455       void GetAtomTable ( PPAtom & atomTable, int & NumberOfAtoms );
00456       void GetAtomTable ( int modelNo, const ChainID chainID,
00457                           int seqNo,   const InsCode insCode,
00458                           PPAtom & atomTable, int & NumberOfAtoms );
00459       void GetAtomTable ( int modelNo, int   chainNo,
00460                           int seqNo,   const InsCode insCode,

00467                           int & NumberOfAtoms );

00469 
00470       //   GetAtomTable1(..) returns atom table without TER atoms and
00471       // without NULL atom pointers. NumberOfAtoms returns the actual
00472       // number of atom pointers in atomTable.
00473       //   atomTable is allocated within the function. If it was
00474       // not set to NULL before calling the function, the function will
00475       // attempt to deallocate it first.
00476       //   The application is responsible for deleting atomTable,
00477       // however it must not touch atom pointers, i.e. use simply
00478       // "delete atomTable;". Never pass atomTable from GetAtomTable(..)
00479       // into this function, unless you set it to NULL before doing that.
00480       void GetAtomTable1 ( PPAtom & atomTable, int & NumberOfAtoms );
00481       void GetAtomTable1 ( int modelNo, const ChainID chainID,
00482                            int seqNo,   const InsCode insCode,
00483                            PPAtom & atomTable, int & NumberOfAtoms );
00484       void GetAtomTable1 ( int modelNo, int   chainNo,
00485                            int seqNo,   const InsCode insCode,
00486                            PPAtom & atomTable, int & NumberOfAtoms );
00487       void GetAtomTable1 ( int modelNo, const ChainID chainID, int resNo,
00488                            PPAtom & atomTable, int & NumberOfAtoms );
00489       void GetAtomTable1 ( int modelNo, int     chainNo, int resNo,
00490                            PPAtom & atomTable, int & NumberOfAtoms );
00491       void GetAtomTable1 ( cpstr CID, PPAtom & atomTable,
00492                            int & NumberOfAtoms );

00541       //  This function leaves only alternative location with maximal
00542       // occupancy, if those are equal or unspecified, the one with
00543       // "least" alternative location indicator.

00545       // the atom index.

00574       //   Frac2Orth(..) and Orth2Frac(..) transform between fractional
00575       // and orthogonal coordinates, if areMatrices() returns true.
00576       // If the transformation matrices were not set, the functions just
00577       // copy the coordinates.  Returns true if the transformation was
00578       // done; False return means that transformation matrices were not
00579       // calculated
00580       bool Frac2Orth (
00581                 realtype   xfrac, realtype   yfrac, realtype   zfrac,
00582                 realtype & xorth, realtype & yorth, realtype & zorth );
00583       bool Orth2Frac (
00584                 realtype   xorth, realtype   yorth, realtype   zorth,
00585                 realtype & xfrac, realtype & yfrac, realtype & zfrac );
00586 
00587 
00588       //   Below, F and T are transformation matrices in fractional and
00589       // orthogonal coordinates, respectively.
00590       bool Frac2Orth ( mat44 & F, mat44 & T );
00591       bool Orth2Frac ( mat44 & T, mat44 & F );
00592 
00593       // ====================  Seeking contacts  ======================
00594 
00595       void  SeekContacts (
00596                PPAtom    AIndex,    // index of atoms [0..ilen-1]
00597                int        ilen,      // length of index
00598                int        atomNum,   // number of 1st contact atom
00599                                      // in the index. All other atoms
00600                                      // are checked for contact with
00601                                      // 1st atom
00602                realtype   dist1,     // minimal contact distance
00603                realtype   dist2,     // maximal contact distance
00604                int        seqDist,   // the sequence distance to neglect.
00605                                      // If seqDist==0, all atoms are
00606                                      // checked for contact. If
00607                                      // seqDist==1, the atoms belonging
00608                                      // to the same residue as atom
00609                                      // AIndex[atomNum], are neglected.
00610                                      // If seqDist>1, all atoms belonging
00611                                      // to residues closer than
00612                                      // +/-(seqDist-1) around that of
00613                                      // atom AIndex[atomNum], are
00614                                      // neglected. If chain is broken
00615                                      // (has a gap) on section
00616                                      // [-(seqDist-1)..seqDist-1], the
00617                                      // section of neglection is
00618                                      // shortened to that gap.
00619                RPContact contact,   // indices of contacting atoms
00620                                      // [0..ncontacts-1]. contact[i].id1
00621                                      // is set to atomNum and
00622                                      // contact[i].id2 is set to the
00623                                      // index of 2nd contacting atom
00624                                      // in vector AIndex
00625                int &      ncontacts, // number of contacts found. If
00626                                      // ncontacts>0 on input, it is
00627                                      // assumed that new contacts that
00628                                      // newly found contacts should be
00629                                      // appended to those already
00630                                      // existing
00631                int        maxlen=0,  // if <=0, then vector contact is
00632                                      // allocated dynamically. If
00633                                      // contact!=NULL, then it is
00634                                      // appended with new contacts.
00635                                      // The application is responsible
00636                                      // for deallocation of contact
00637                                      // after use.
00638                                      //   If maxlen>0 then vector contact
00639                                      // is prohibited of dynamical
00640                                      // allocation/deallocation. In this
00641                                      // case, not more than maxlen
00642                                      // contacts will be returned.
00643                long       group=0    // a contact group ID, which will be
00644                                      // simply stored in contact[i].group
00645                                      // fields. This ID may be useful
00646                                      // if contacts are obtained in
00647                                      // multiple calls of the function
00648                          );
00649 
00650       void  SeekContacts (
00651                PAtom     A,         // 1st atom in contact
00652                PPAtom    AIndex,    // index of atoms [0..ilen-1] to
00653                                      // check for contact with 1st atom
00654                int        ilen,      // length of index
00655                realtype   dist1,     // minimal contact distance
00656                realtype   dist2,     // maximal contact distance
00657                int        seqDist,   // the sequence distance to neglect.
00658                                      // If seqDist==0, all atoms are
00659                                      // checked for contact. If
00660                                      // seqDist==1, the atoms belonging
00661                                      // to the same residue as atom
00662                                      // A, are neglected. If seqDist>1,
00663                                      // all atoms belonging to residues
00664                                      // closer than +/-(seqDist-1) around
00665                                      // that of atom A, are neglected. If
00666                                      // chain is broken (has a gap) on
00667                                      // section
00668                                      // [-(seqDist-1)..seqDist-1], the
00669                                      // section of neglection is
00670                                      // shortened to that gap.
00671                RPContact contact,   // indices of contacting atoms
00672                                      // [0..ncontacts-1]. contact[i].id1
00673                                      // is set to -1, and contact[i].id2
00674                                      // is set to the index of 2nd
00675                                      // contacting atom in vector AIndex
00676                int &      ncontacts, // number of contacts found. If
00677                                      // ncontacts>0 on input, it is
00678                                      // assumed that new contacts that
00679                                      // newly found contacts should be
00680                                      // appended those already existing
00681                int        maxlen=0,  // if <=0, then vector contact is
00682                                      // allocated dynamically. If
00683                                      // contact!=NULL, then it is
00684                                      // appended with new contacts.
00685                                      // The application is responsible
00686                                      // for deallocation of contact
00687                                      // after use.
00688                                      //   If maxlen>0 then vector contact
00689                                      // is prohibited of dynamical
00690                                      // allocation/deallocation. In this
00691                                      // case, not more than maxlen
00692                                      // contacts will be returned.
00693                long       group=0    // a contact group ID, which will be
00694                                      // simply stored in contact[i].group
00695                                      // fields. This ID may be useful
00696                                      // if contacts are obtained in
00697                                      // multiple calls of the function
00698                          );
00699 
00700       void  SeekContacts (
00701                PPAtom    AIndex1,   //  1st atom index [0..ilen1-1]
00702                int        ilen1,     //  length of 1st index
00703                PPAtom    AIndex2,   //  2nd atom index [0..ilen2-1] to
00704                                      // check for contact with 1st index
00705                int        ilen2,     //  length of 2nd index
00706                realtype   dist1,     //  minimal contact distance
00707                realtype   dist2,     //  maximal contact distance
00708                int        seqDist,   //  the sequence distance to
00709                                      // neglect.
00710                                      //  If seqDist==0, all atoms are
00711                                      // checked for contact.
00712                                      //  If seqDist==1, the atoms
00713                                      // belonging to the same residue
00714                                      // are neglected.
00715                                      //  If seqDist>1, all atoms
00716                                      // belonging to residues closer than
00717                                      // +/-(seqDist-1) to each other,
00718                                      // are neglected. If chain is broken
00719                                      // (has a gap) on section
00720                                      // [-(seqDist-1)..seqDist-1], the
00721                                      // section of neglection is
00722                                      // shortened to that gap.
00723                RPContact contact,   //  indices of contacting atoms
00724                                      // [0..ncontacts-1]. contact[i].id1
00725                                      // contains number of atom from 1st
00726                                      // index, and contact[i].id2
00727                                      // contains number of atom from 2nd
00728                                      // index, contacting with the former
00729                                      // one
00730                int &      ncontacts, //  number of contacts found. If
00731                                      // ncontacts>0 on input, it is
00732                                      // assumed that newly found
00733                                      // contacts should be appended to
00734                                      // those already existing
00735                int        maxlen=0,  //  if <=0, then vector contact is
00736                                      // allocated dynamically. If
00737                                      // contact!=NULL, then it is
00738                                      // appended with new contacts.
00739                                      // The application is responsible
00740                                      // for deallocation of contact
00741                                      // after use.
00742                                      //   If maxlen>0 then vector contact
00743                                      // is prohibited of dynamical
00744                                      // allocation/deallocation. In this
00745                                      // case, not more than maxlen
00746                                      // contacts will be returned.
00747                mat44 * TMatrix=NULL, //  transformation matrix for 2nd
00748                                      // set of atoms (AIndex2)
00749                long       group=0,   //  a contact group ID, which will
00750                                      // be stored in contact[i].group
00751                                      // fields. This ID may be useful
00752                                      // if contacts are obtained in
00753                                      // multiple calls of the function
00754                int     bricking=0,   //  bricking control; may be a
00755                                      // combination of BRICK_ON_1 or
00756                                      // BRICK_ON_2 with BRICK_READY
00757                bool    doSqrt=true   // if False, then Contact contains
00758                                      // square distances
00759                          );
00760 
00761       //  Simplified optimized for speed version:
00762       //    - no NULL pointers and Ters in AIndex1 and AIndex2
00763       //    - no checks for identity atoms in AIndex1 and AIndex2
00764       //    - contact must be pre-allocated with at least ilen1*ilen2
00765       //      elements
00766       //    - contact returns square distances
00767       //    - ncontacts is always reset
00768       void  SeekContacts (
00769                PPAtom    AIndex1,   //  1st atom index [0..ilen1-1]
00770                int        ilen1,     //  length of 1st index
00771                PPAtom    AIndex2,   //  2nd atom index [0..ilen2-1] to
00772                                      // check for contact with 1st index
00773                int        ilen2,     //  length of 2nd index
00774                realtype   contDist,  //  maximal contact distance
00775                PContact  contact,   //  indices of contacting atoms
00776                                      // [0..ncontacts-1]. contact[i].id1
00777                                      // contains number of atom from 1st
00778                                      // index, and contact[i].id2
00779                                      // contains number of atom from 2nd
00780                                      // index, contacting with the former
00781                                      // one. Must be pre-allocated
00782                int &      ncontacts, //  number of contacts found
00783                int       bricking=0  //  bricking control; may be a
00784                                      // combination of BRICK_ON_1 or
00785                                      // BRICK_ON_2 with BRICK_READY
00786                          );
00787 
00788       void  SeekContacts (
00789              PPAtom       AIndex1,  //  1st atom index [0..ilen1-1]
00790              int           ilen1,    //  length of 1st index
00791              PPAtom *     AIndex2,  //  indexes of atoms to be checked
00792                                      // for contact with each atom from
00793                                      // Aindex1; dimension
00794                                      // [0..nStructures-1][0..ilen2[i]-1]
00795              ivector       ilen2,    //  lengths of indexes AIndex2
00796              int           nStructures, //  number of indexes AIndex2
00797              realtype      dist1,    //  minimal contact distance
00798              realtype      dist2,    //  maximal contact distance
00799              PPMContact & contact,  // resulting contacts, one structure
00800                                      // per each position in AIndex1. If
00801                                      // AIndex1[i] is NULL, contact[i] is
00802                                      // also NULL. "contact" is always
00803                                      // allocated, no re-use or
00804                                      // re-allocation is attempted.
00805              int            bricking=0  //  bricking control; may be
00806                                      // BRICK_READY if AIndex2 does not
00807                                     // change
00808                          );

00850   //   GetEulerRotMatrix(..) calculates the Euler rotation matrix
00851   // for rotation:
00852   //                   1) about z-axis by angle alpha
00853   //                   2) about new y-axis by angle beta
00854   //                   3) about new z-axis by angle gamma
00855   extern void  GetEulerRotMatrix ( mat33 & erm,   realtype alpha,
00856                                    realtype beta, realtype gamma );
00857 
00858   //  GetEulerTMatrix(..) calculates the Euler rotation-translation
00859   // matrix for rotation:
00860   //                   1) about z-axis by angle alpha
00861   //                   2) about new y-axis by angle beta
00862   //                   3) about new z-axis by angle gamma
00863   //  Point (x0,y0,z0) is the center of rotation.
00864   extern void  GetEulerTMatrix ( mat44 & erm,   realtype alpha,
00865                             realtype beta, realtype gamma,
00866                             realtype x0,   realtype y0,  realtype z0 );
00867 
00868   //  Euler rotation:  1) about z-axis by angle alpha
00869   //                   2) about new y-axis by angle beta
00870   //                   3) about new z-axis by angle gamma
00871   //  Point (x0,y0,z0) is the center of rotation.
00872   extern void EulerRotation ( PPAtom A, int nA,
00873                            realtype alpha, realtype beta, realtype gamma,
00874                            realtype x0,    realtype y0,   realtype z0 );
00875 
00876   //   GetVecRotMatrix(..) calculates the rotation matrix for
00877   // rotation by angle alpha about arbitrary vector directed
00878   // as (vx,vy,vz) = (vx2-vx1,vy2-vy1,vz2-vz1).
00879   extern void GetVecRotMatrix ( mat33 & vrm,  realtype alpha,
00880                              realtype vx,  realtype vy, realtype vz );
00881 
00882 
00883   //    Given the rotation matrix vrm, GetRotParameters(..)
00884   //  returns the rotation angle alpha and the normalized
00885   //  rotation axis vector (vx,vy,vz).
00886   //    The rotation angle and vector are determined up to
00887   //  their sign (however correlated, so that being substituted
00888   //  into GetVecRotMatrix(..) they yield the same rotation
00889   //  matrix).
00890   //    The function does not check for vrm to be a valid
00891   //  rotation matrix.
00892   extern void GetRotParameters ( mat33 & vrm, realtype & alpha,
00893                          realtype & vx, realtype & vy, realtype & vz );
00894 
00895 
00896   //   GetVecTMatrix(..) calculates the rotation-translation matrix
00897   // for rotation by angle alpha about arbitrary vector directed as
00898   // (vx,vy,vz) = (vx2-vx1,vy2-vy1,vz2-vz1). Point (x0,y0,z0) is
00899   // the center of rotation -- actually a point belonging to the
00900   // rotation axis.
00901   extern void GetVecTMatrix  ( mat44 & vrm, realtype alpha,
00902                                realtype vx, realtype vy, realtype vz,
00903                                realtype x0, realtype y0, realtype z0 );
00904 
00905   //   Vector rotation is rotation by angle alpha about arbitrary
00906   // vector directed as (vx,vy,vz) = (vx2-vx1,vy2-vy1,vz2-vz1).
00907   // Point (x0,y0,z0) is the center of rotation -- actually
00908   // a point belonging to the rotation axis.
00909   extern void VectorRotation ( PPAtom A, int nA,  realtype alpha,
00910                                realtype vx, realtype vy, realtype vz,
00911                                realtype x0, realtype y0, realtype z0 );

00914                         realtype & xmc, realtype & ymc, realtype & zmc );

00917   enum SPOSEAT_RC  {
00918     SPOSEAT_Ok       = 0,
00919     SPOSEAT_NoAtoms  = 1,
00920     SPOSEAT_SVD_Fail = 2
00921   };
00922 
00923   //   Given two sets of atoms, A1 and A2, SuperposeAtoms(...) calculates
00924   // the rotational-translational matrix T such that |T*A1 - A2| is
00925   // minimal in least-square terms.
00926   //   If vector C is not given (default), all nA atoms of set A1 are
00927   // considered as corresponding to nA first atoms of set A2,
00928   // A1[i] <-> A2[i], 0<=i<nA .
00929   //   If vector C is given, then the correspondence of atoms is
00930   // established as A1[i] <-> A2[C[i]] only for those i that C[i]>=0.
00931   // The default option (C==NULL) is thus identical to C[i]==i, 0<=i<nA.
00932   //   Upon normal completion, the procedure returns SPOSEAT_Ok.
00933 
00934   extern int SuperposeAtoms ( mat44 & T, PPAtom A1, int nA, PPAtom A2,
00935                               ivector C=NULL );
00936 
00937   enum CNSORT_DIR  {
00938     CNSORT_OFF  = 0,
00939     CNSORT_1INC = 1,
00940     CNSORT_1DEC = 2,
00941     CNSORT_2INC = 3,
00942     CNSORT_2DEC = 4,
00943     CNSORT_DINC = 5,
00944     CNSORT_DDEC = 6
00945   };
00946 
00947   extern void  SortContacts ( PContact contact, int ncontacts,
00948                               CNSORT_DIR sortmode );
